subject: Entrepreneurship
title: Why Most Startups Fail
description: A 60-second lesson on Why Most Startups Fail.

hook.text: Nine out of ten startups fail. But the number-one killer isn't moneyâ€”it's building something nobody wants.

buildup.text: Founders spend months perfecting products in secret, certain customers will love them.

discovery.text: A CB Insights study found 42% of failed startups had no market need. They solved imaginary problems.

twist.text: The most talented teams with the best funding still fail when they skip talking to real customers.

climax.text: Eric Ries saw this pattern at his startup IMVU and asked: what if failure is a learning problem?
